title: Installs fail under Amazon Linux 2
body:
Spack 0.11.1 and 0.11.2 fails to install any application. Configure step gives error.

### Expected Result

Clean install, e.g.

spack install bioawk

### Actual Result
```
   ==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/tmp/spack/spack-0.11.1/var/spack/stage/libsigsegv-2.11-p2hitps4hgnawuvn6axcudlawfd74oiw/libsigsegv-2.11/configure' '--prefix=/tmp/spack/spack-0.11.1/opt/spack/linux-amzn2-x86_64/gcc-7.3.1/libsigsegv-2.11-p2hitps4hgnawuvn6axcudlawfd74oiw' '--enable-shared'

1 error found in build log:
     1     ==> Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
     2     ==> Executing phase: 'configure'
     3     ==> '/tmp/spack/spack-0.11.1/var/spack/stage/libsigsegv-2.11-p2hitps4hgnawuvn6axcudlawfd74oiw/libsigsegv-2.11/configure' '--prefix=/tmp/spack/spack-0.11.1/opt/spack/linux-amzn2-x86_64/gcc-7.3.1/libsigsegv-2.11-p2hitps4hgnawuvn6axcudlawfd74oiw' '--enable-shared'
     4     
     5     Build Tools:
     6     checking for a BSD-compatible install... /usr/bin/install -c
  >> 7     checking whether build environment is sane... configure: error: unsafe absolute working directory name
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install bioawk
$ spack install samtools
...
```

### Information on your system
```
 ./spack arch
linux-amzn2-x86_64
```
under an AWS Workspaces instance.

No customizations. Clean install from git followed by install command produces error.

-----

1) Launch an AWS  Amazon Linux 2 Workspace.
2) Login 
3) git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
4) cd spack/bin;  ./spack install samtools
